name: Eglin's 30th Street Garage Corporation, Appellant, v. Bulletin Company
name_abbreviation: Eglin's 30th Street Garage Corp. v. Bulletin Co.

judges: Before Bell, C. J., Eagen, O’Brien, Roberts, Pomeroy and Barbieri, JJ.
parties: Eglin’s 30th Street Garage Corporation, Appellant, v. Bulletin Company.

opinions.text:
Opinion
Per Curiam,
Decree affirmed. Costs on appellant.
Mr. Justice Jones took no part in the consideration or decision of this case.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: Jerome E. Bogutz, with him Lawrence Mazer, Norman Mittman, and Bogutz and Mazer, for appellant.
John H. Lewis, Jr., Seymour Kurland, Leon E. Sperling, with them Morgan, Lewis & Bochius, and Wolf, Bloch, Schorr & Solis-Oohen, for appellees.
casebody.head_matter:
Eglin’s 30th Street Garage Corporation, Appellant, v. Bulletin Company.
Argued May 3, 1971.
Before Bell, C. J., Eagen, O’Brien, Roberts, Pomeroy and Barbieri, JJ.
Jerome E. Bogutz, with him Lawrence Mazer, Norman Mittman, and Bogutz and Mazer, for appellant.
John H. Lewis, Jr., Seymour Kurland, Leon E. Sperling, with them Morgan, Lewis & Bochius, and Wolf, Bloch, Schorr & Solis-Oohen, for appellees.
December 20, 1971:
